Welcome to Predicting Undernutrition’s documentation!

predunder package

Submodules

predunder.functions module

src.predunder.functions.df_to_dataset(dataframe, label, shuffle=True, batch_size=8)[source]

Convert a Pandas DataFrame into a Tensorflow Dataset.

Parameters

  • dataframe (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame to be converted

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • shuffle (bool, optional) – shuffles the dataset

  • batch_size (int, optional) – batch size of the dataset

Returns

Tensorflow Dataset based on the DataFrame

Return type

tensorflow.data.Dataset

Note

The dataframe is required to have this as one of its columns.

Todo

The function implicitly assumes that the label column only has values “INCREASED RISK” or “REDUCED RISK”.

src.predunder.functions.df_to_image(dataframe, mean_df, std_df, label, img_size, out_dir)[source]

Convert a Pandas DataFrame into a directory of images without regard for pixel position.

Parameters

  • dataframe (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame to convert into images

  • mean_df (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of column means for normalization

  • std_df (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of column standard deviations for normalization

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • img_size ((int, int)) – dimensions of the resulting images

  • out_dir (str) – output directory where the images will be stored

Todo

Categorical variables are hard-coded.

src.predunder.functions.df_to_nparray(dataframe, label)[source]

Split a Pandas DataFrame into features and labels.

Parameters

  • dataframe (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame to be converted

  • label – name of the target column for supervised learning

Returns

features and labels for supervised learning

Return type

(numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray)

Note

The dataframe is required to have this as one of its columns.

Todo

This is currently not being used anywhere.

src.predunder.functions.get_metrics(predicted, actual)[source]

Extract relevant metrics from predictions.

Parameters

  • predicted (numpy.ndarray) – array of predictions

  • actual (numpy.ndarray) – array of ground truth

Returns

model evaluation metrics (accuracy, sensitivity, specificity)

Return type

(float, float, float)

Todo

This currently does not have Cohen’s Kappa.

src.predunder.functions.image_to_dataset(dir, img_size)[source]

Create a Tensorflow Dataset from a directory of images.

Parameters

  • dir (str) – directory of the images

  • img_size ((int, int)) – dimension of the images

Returns

Tensorflow Dataset based on the images

Return type

tensorflow.data.Dataset

Todo

The batch size is fixed to 32.

src.predunder.functions.kfold_metrics_to_df(metrics)[source]

Convert a k-fold metrics dictionary into a Pandas DataFrame row for analysis.

Parameters

metrics (dict) – dictionary of metrics from predunder.training.train_kfold(..)

Returns

DataFrame with a single row

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

src.predunder.functions.oversample_data(train_set, label, oversample='none')[source]

Perform oversampling over the minority class using the specific technique.

Parameters

  • train_set (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the training set

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • oversample (str, optional) – oversampling algorithm to be applied (“none”, “smote”, “adasyn”, “borderline”)

Returns

DataFrame of training set with oversampled data

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

predunder.hypertuning module

src.predunder.hypertuning.tune_dnn(train, label, folds, max_nodes, oversample='none')[source]

Brute force number of nodes in a neural network up to three hidden layers.

Parameters

  • train (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the training set

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • fold (int) – number of folds for k-fold cross-validation

  • max_nodes (int) – maximum number of nodes per layer

  • oversample (str, optional) – oversampling algorithm to be applied (“none”, “smote”, “adasyn”, “borderline”)

Returns

DataFrame of results

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

predunder.training module

src.predunder.training.train_dnn(train, test, label, features, layers, oversample='none')[source]

Train a dense neural network model and make predictions.

Parameters

  • train (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the training set

  • test (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the testing set

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • features (list[str]) – features to include in training

  • layers (list[int]) – number of nodes per hidden layer in the neural network

  • oversample (str, optional) – oversampling algorithm to be applied (“none”, “smote”, “adasyn”, “borderline”)

Returns

array of class predictions

Return type

np.ndarray[int]

Todo

Build custom evaluation functions to get the model predictions with Tensorflow.

src.predunder.training.train_images(train, test, label, convert_func, img_size, tmp_dir, oversample='none', base_model='mobilenetv2', learning_rate=0.0001)[source]

Converts tabular data into images and train a classifier with transfer learning.

Parameters

  • train (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the training set

  • test (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the testing set

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • convert_func (Callable[.., None]) – table to image converter function

  • img_size ((int, int)) – dimension of the resulting images

  • tmp_dir (str) – output directory where the images will be temporarily stored

  • base_model (str, optional) – base model for transfer learning from Keras

  • learning_rate (float, optional) – learning rate for the neural network

Returns

array of class predictions

Return type

numpy.array[int]

Todo

Build custom evaluation functions to get the model predictions with Tensorflow, and implement early stopping from validation loss.

src.predunder.training.train_kfold(train_set, label, num_fold, train_func, **kwargs)[source]

Validate a model with stratified k-fold cross validation.

Parameters

  • train_set (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the training set

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • num_fold (int) – number of folds

  • train_func (Callable[.., (flaot,flaot,flaot)]) – training function of the model being validated

  • **kwargs –

    other keyword arguments for the training function

Returns

dictionary of metrics.

Return type

dict[‘ACCURACY’|’SENSITIVITY’|’SPECIFICITY’][‘ALL’|’MEAN’|’STD’]

Todo

The function implicitly assumes that the label column only has values “INCREASED RISK” or “REDUCED RISK”.

src.predunder.training.train_naive_hive(train, test, label, num_hive, train_network, **kwargs)[source]

Train a random hive with neural networks of the same architecture on the whole training set.

Parameters

  • train (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the training set

  • test (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the testing set

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • num_hive (int) – number of networks in the hive

  • train_network – training function for each network

  • **kwargs –

    other keyword arguments for the training function

Type

Callable[.., numpy.ndarray[int]]

Returns

array of class predictions

Return type

numpy.ndarray[int]

Todo

Implement option for smarter voting.
